title: Jared Zirkes - Data Science Portfolio
text:
Welcome to My Data Science Portfolio
Welcome to the official website of Jared Zirkes, a passionate data scientist. On this site, you’ll find a collection of my data science projects, insights, and experiments, showcasing my journey in the world of data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling.

About Me
I hold a Master of Science in Data Science & Analytics from Georgetown University and a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with a focus on Finance, Economics-Strategy, and Business Analytics. With a background in analytics, I have experience in conducting research, building predictive models, and delivering actionable insights.


Projects
Here are some of the key data science projects I’ve worked on:

MLB Hall of Fame Career Stats: A project aimed at analyzing career statistics of MLB players to predict future Hall of Fame inductees.
News Recommender System: A document retrieval system designed to recommend articles from diverse viewpoints.
Baseball Simulation: A machine learning model to simulate MLB games based on player and team data.

For more details, visit each individual project page.


Contact
Feel free to reach out to me via email for collaboration, inquiries, or just to connect!

title: Contact - Jared Zirkes
text:
Contact Me
I am always open to collaboration, inquiries, or just connecting with other professionals. Feel free to reach out to me!

Email: jared@example.com
LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/jaredzirkes
GitHub: github.com/yourusername

Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Projects - Jared Zirkes
text:
Here are some of the data science projects I have worked on:


In this project, I analyze career statistics of MLB players to predict future Hall of Fame inductees. The model uses various performance metrics and historical voting trends to make predictions.

Technologies used: Python, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib
Key Features: Data cleaning, feature engineering, predictive modeling, visualization

View Project on GitHub




This document retrieval system is designed to recommend articles from diverse viewpoints to users based on their preferences. It uses natural language processing (NLP) to match articles with similar topics.

Technologies used: Python, NLP, Flask, Scikit-learn
Key Features: Text similarity, machine learning, recommendation systems

View Project on GitHub




A machine learning model simulating baseball games based on player and team data. This project focuses on creating a realistic simulation by incorporating various factors such as player stats, historical performance, and game conditions.

Technologies used: Python, TensorFlow, Pandas
Key Features: Simulations, model training, performance analysis

View Project on GitHub
